definition-item.definition-title: DEVICES, APPARATUS OR METHODS FOR LIFE-SAVING (valves specially adapted for medical use A61M39/00; life-saving devices, apparatus or methods specially adapted for use in water B63C9/00; divers' equipment B63C11/00; specially adopted for use with aircraft, e.g. parachutes, ejector seats, {B64D17/00, B64D25/10}; rescue devices peculiar to mining E21F11/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Life-saving devices in the sense of rescuing persons in immediate and physical danger due to possibly harmful surroundings, e.g. fire, toxic gases, falling from heights.
Life-saving in the medical sense is in A61M
Life-saving for use in water/on sea: B63C9/00
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Rescue devices for use in water/on sea

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Safety during construction of buildings(this includes anchors for safety-lines, lifelines and similar)

abbreviations.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following abbreviations are often used:

table-column.paragraph-text: Powered Air Purifying Respirator(Filter and Blower)
Self-Contained (Underwater) Breathing Apparatus(Breathing apparatus with compressed air, or closed circuit breathing apparatus)

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for lowering persons from buildings or the like

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices to lower persons from heights, e.g. high-rise buildings.
Mountaineering : A63B29/00
Climbing devices for poles, trees or similar: A63B27/00
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Emergency escape exits for airplanes (e.g. inflatable chutes)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Chutes, slides or similar for amusement
Rope, cable or chain winding mechanisms

section-body.paragraph-text: A62B1/06: also includes rope-lowering devices for mountaineering.

definition-item.definition-title: Devices or single parts for facilitating escape from buildings or the like, e.g. protection shields, protection screens; Portable devices for preventing smoke penetrating into distinct parts of buildings (A62B1/00 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Devices to allow persons to find their way out of dangerous situations; e.g. emergency exit signs, cutting implements (e.g. hydraulic scissors), emergency hammers, ropes with feelable indicators towards the next exit.
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Construction of visible, audible or tactile signalling devices (e.g. emergency exit signs)

section-body.paragraph-text: A62B3/005: Devices forcing an action, e.g. cutting implements, emergency hammers.

definition-item.definition-title: Other devices for rescuing from fire (ladders E06C)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Platforms for use on ladders; liftable and lowerable platforms

definition-item.definition-title: Respiratory apparatus (for medical purposes A61M16/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Breathing devices used in emergency cases, where breathing is otherwise not possible or potentially dangerous.
Breathing devices for medical purposes: A61M16/00
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for storing, carrying or holding respiratory apparatus

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Air-treatment apparatus for aircraft crew or passengers

definition-item.definition-title: Component parts for respiratory or breathing apparatus (A62B19/00, A62B21/00, A62B23/00 take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Elements used for respiratory or breathing apparatuses not provided for elsewhere, e.g. valves, breathing demand regulators, couplings, supporting frames for breathing apparatus (e.g. backpacks.)
Cartridges with absorbing substances (e.g. active carbon): A62B19/00
Devices for producing oxygen by a chemical reaction: A62B21/00
Filters: A62B23/00
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cartridges with absorbing substances for respiratory apparatus
Devices producing oxygen from chemical substances for respiratory apparatus
Valves for use in medical breathing devices

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Valves in breathing masks or helmets

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for reconditioning breathing air in sealed rooms (chemical purification, disinfection, or sterilisation of air A61L; in aircraft or submarines, insofar as they influence the construction of the vehicle or are influenced by its construction B63B, B64D, respectively; air-conditioning in general F24F)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices for reconditioning breathing air in sealed rooms, e.g. air-raid shelters, high-security rooms, by filtering and reconditioning the air in the room (no outside air, no compressed air).
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Chemical purification, disinfection, or sterilisation of air
In aircraft or submarines, insofar as they influence the construction of the vehicle or are influenced by its construction

definition-item.definition-title: Special devices for ventilating gasproof shelters (ventilating in general F24F)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Special devices for ventilating gasproof shelters, e.g. air-raid shelters with provisions to filter chemical and/or biological and/or nuclear contaminants from outside air before delivering this air to the inside of the shelter (specifically if including provisions to protect the inside of the shelter agains shockwaves from explosions).
This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: Installations affording protection against poisonous or injurious substances, e.g. with separate breathing apparatus ({preventing escape of dirt or fumes from the area where they are produced B08B15/00}; building aspects E04H9/00 {; use of air currents for screening F24F9/00})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Installed devices necessary to protect against poisonous or injurious substances.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Containers or portable cabins for affording breathing protection
Preventing escape of dirt or fumes from the area where they are produced
Use of air currents in for screening

definition-item.definition-title: Protective clothing affording protection against heat or harmful chemical agents or for use at high altitudes (protective clothing or garments for work or sport A41D13/00; {e.g. overalls A41D13/02, surgical gowns A41D13/12; materials for protecting clothing A41D31/04}; protecting eyes or ears A61F9/00; composition of materials for protective clothing A62D5/00; life-saving garments for use at sea B63C; diving suits B63C11/02; flight suits B64D10/00; space suits B64G6/00; bullet-proof clothing F41H1/02)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Clothing which protects against high or low temperatures,this concerns especially adaptations to clothing which improve the suitability to use this clothing in certain circumstances, e.g. joint construction to improve flexibility while maintaining full protection, sealings of clothing to ensure air-tightness between the clothing and the wearer.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Protective clothing for work or sport
Composition of materials for protective clothing
Life-saving garments for use at sea

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Half-masks which are made out of filter-material
Details of garments, e.g. closures, seams

definition-item.definition-title: Breathing masks or helmets, e.g. affording protection against chemical agents or for use at high altitudes {or incorporating a pump or compressor for reducing the inhalation effort} (A62B17/00 takes precedence; anaesthetic masks A61M16/06)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Breathing masks or helmets where the construction of the mask or helmet is concerned.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Storing devices for breathing masks or helmets

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fastening of respirators or breathing masks to helmets

definition-item.definition-title: Cartridges with absorbing substances for respiratory apparatus {(carbon dioxide absorbing devices A61M16/22)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
the mechanical construction of cartridges with absorbing substances.
This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for producing oxygen from chemical substances for respiratory apparatus

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Devices producing oxygen for respiratory apparatus from chemical substances where the construction of the device or the relationship with the breathing apparatus is concerned. E.g. the construction of the housing of "candles" burning chemicals to produce oxygen which is fed to breathing apparatus in regard to form, thermal optimisation (shedding of heat without endangering the user).
This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: Filters for breathing-protection purposes (gas-filters in general B01D)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Filters and filtering media used to protect users of breathing apparatus from toxic environments, also masks made out of a filtering material.
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Face masks of for use in foul atmosphere (protection during work against dust, splashes/liquids, or exterior impact)
Filters in breathing apparatus used for medical or therapeutical purposes

section-body.paragraph-text: When mask protects against splashes/liquids, dust or exterior impact, classification should be in A41D13/11.
When filtering or respiratory protection of the mask is relevant, classification should be done in A62B23/025.
When both kind of protections are specified, both classes should be given.

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for storing {or holding or carrying} respiratory or breathing apparatus

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices, apparatus or similar to store, hold or carry breathing apparatus.
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Methods or devices for testing respiratory or breathing apparatus {for high altitudes} (apparatus for testing gastightness in general G01M)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Testing of respiratory or breathing apparatus to indicate readiness of use, certification for certain tasks (e.g. high altitudes (meaning in aircraft, for mountain climbing, but not in outer space/vacuum), legal, ergonomic, or other requirements);
Indicating devices to indicate necessary refill/service of the apparatus (e.g. after previous use)
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus for testing gastightness in general
"Artificial head" for testing gastightness of masks and helmets

definition-item.definition-title: Devices, e.g. installations, for rendering harmless or for keeping off harmful chemical agents (respiratory apparatus A62B7/00; gasproof doors, windows, shutters E06B)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Other devices for dealing with chemical agents which are not respiratory apparatus, e.g. devices including substances that eliminate chemical agents
This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: Containers or portable cabins for affording breathing protection with devices for reconditioning the breathing air or for ventilating, {in particular those that are suitable for invalids or small children} (ventilation of gasproof shelters A62B13/00; protective clothes or coverings A62B17/00; treatment rooms for medical purposes A61G10/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Mobile shelters (e.g. containers, cabins, tents) including breathing protection apparatus.
This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for allowing seemingly-dead persons to escape or draw attention; Breathing apparatus for accidentally buried persons

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices allowing accidentally buried person to indicate their location (e.g. victims of avalanches, earthquakes.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Means for indicating the location of accidentally buried person while mountaineering
Devices for in and under water
Detection of hidden masses in general

definition-item.definition-title: Safety belts or body harnesses; Similar equipment for limiting displacement of the human body, especially in case of sudden changes of motion (buckles A44B11/00; accessories for children's furniture A47D15/00; children's seats B60N2/24; safety belts or body harnesses for land vehicles B60R22/00; harnesses for parachutes B64D17/30; harnessing in aircraft B64D25/06; releasable fastenings F16B)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices which keep people safe working at exposed position, e.g. catching devices for workers at heights; this includes lifeline constructions, harnesses, safety belts.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Hunting stands (shooting stands used for hunting)
Baby-walk harnesses, harnesses to guide children
Restraining devices for orthopaedic means (attaching a body to e.g. bed, chair,...)
Safety devices used in combination with a ladder

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Safety devices used during construction of buildings
Means for fastening cables or ropes to one another or other objects; e.g. tensioning devices
